content: Anthropic's business model focuses on technical end-users like developers, researchers, and enterprise teams, securing deals for custom, private, enterprise-grade AI solutions.

content: OpenAI's business model is characterized by mass distribution, exemplified by ChatGPT's rapid growth through public release rather than enterprise sales.

content: Sam Altman's strategy is to make custom enterprise AI contracts unnecessary by commoditizing AI agent technology for widespread use.

content: OpenClaw is an autonomous AI agent that can control an entire computer, performing tasks like reading emails, writing code, browsing the web, and negotiating deals.

content: Peter Steinberger, OpenClaw's creator, predicts that "OpenClaw-style agents will kill 80% of apps," a prediction now effectively OpenAI's roadmap.

content: Goldman Sachs' AI agents complete work rather than just answering questions, handling tasks like reconciling transactions, flagging discrepancies, filing settlements, parsing client passports, running compliance checks, and generating onboarding files.
